detaileddescription.para: Common SD_control() command code reservation offset. SD driver implementations should offset command codes with SD_CMD_RESERVED growing positively.
Example implementation specific command codes: #defineSDXYZ_CMD_COMMAND0(SD_CMD_RESERVED+0) #defineSDXYZ_CMD_COMMAND1(SD_CMD_RESERVED+1)
Common SD_control status code reservation offset. SD driver implementations should offset status codes with SD_STATUS_RESERVED growing negatively.
Example implementation specific status codes: #defineSDXYZ_STATUS_ERROR0(SD_STATUS_RESERVED-0) #defineSDXYZ_STATUS_ERROR1(SD_STATUS_RESERVED-1) #defineSDXYZ_STATUS_ERROR2(SD_STATUS_RESERVED-2)

briefdescription.para: Successful status code returned by SD_control().

detaileddescription.para: SD_control() returns SD_STATUS_SUCCESS if the control code was executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Generic error status code returned by SD_control().

detaileddescription.para: SD_control() returns SD_STATUS_ERROR if the control code was not executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by SD_control() for undefined command codes.

detaileddescription.para: SD_control() returns SD_STATUS_UNDEFINEDCMD if the control code is not recognized by the driver implementation.
Unrecognized Card
Multi-media Memory Card (MMC)
Standard SDCard (SDSC)
High Capacity SDCard (SDHC)

briefdescription.para: SD Card type inserted.
A handle that is returned from a SD_open() call.
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_CloseFxn().

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_controlFxn().

A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_OpenFxn().

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_writeFxn().
SD Global configuration.

detaileddescription.para: The SD_Config structure contains a set of pointers used to characterize the SD driver implementation.
This structure needs to be defined before calling SD_init() and it must not be changed thereafter.

briefdescription.para: Function to close a SD peripheral specified by the SD handle.

simplesect.para: SD_open() had to be called first.

briefdescription.para: Function performs implementation specific features on a given SD_Handle.

detaileddescription.para: Commands for SD_control can originate from SD.h or from implementation specific SD*.h files. While commands from SD.h are API portable across driver implementations, not all implementations may support all these commands. Conversely, commands from driver implementation specific SD*.h files add unique driver capabilities but are not API portable across all SD driver implementations.
Commands supported by SD.h follow a SD*_CMD naming convention.
Commands supported by SD*.h follow a SD*_CMD naming convention. Each control command defines arg differently. The types of arg are documented with each command.
See SD_control command codes for command codes.
See SD_control return status codes for status codes.

simplesect.para: SD_open() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: An optional R/W (read/write) command argument accompanied with cmd.

simplesect.para: Implementation specific return codes. Negative values indicate unsuccessful operations.

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_getNumSectors(). Note: Total Card capacity is the (NumberOfSectors * SectorSize).

simplesect.para: SD Card has been initialized using SD_initialize().
The total number of sectors on the SD card, or 0 if an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Function to obtain the sector size used to access the SD card.

simplesect.para: SD Card has been initialized using SD_initialize().
The sector size set for use during SD card read/write operations.

briefdescription.para: This function initializes the SD driver.

simplesect.para: The SD_config[] array must exist and be persistent before this function can be called. This function must also be called before any other SD driver APIs. This function call does not modify any peripheral registers.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the SD_Params struct to its defaults.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to SD_Params structure for initialization.

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_initialize().

simplesect.para: SD controller has been opened by calling SD_open().
SD_STATUS_SUCCESS if no errors occurred during the initialization, SD_STATUS_ERROR otherwise.

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_open().

simplesect.para: SD controller has been initialized using SD_init().

parameterdescription.para: Logical peripheral number for the SD indexed into the SD_config[] table.
Pointer to a parameter block, if NULL it will use default values. All the fields in this structure are RO (read-only).

simplesect.para: A SD_Handle on success or a NULL on an error or if it has been opened already.

memberdef.argsstring: (SD_Handle handle, void *buf, int_fast32_t sector, uint_fast32_t secCount)
memberdef.name: SD_read

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_read().

simplesect.para: SD controller has been opened and initialized by calling SD_open() followed by SD_initialize().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a buffer to read data into.
Starting sector on the disk to read from.
Number of sectors to be read.

simplesect.para: SD_STATUS_SUCCESS if no errors occurred during the write, SD_STATUS_ERROR otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (SD_Handle handle, const void *buf, int_fast32_t sector, uint_fast32_t secCount)
memberdef.name: SD_write

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of SD_write().

simplesect.para: SD controller has been opened and initialized by calling SD_open() followed by SD_initialize().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a buffer containing data to write to disk.
Starting sector on the disk to write to.
Number of sectors to be written.

simplesect.para: SD_STATUS_SUCCESS if no errors occurred during the write, SD_STATUS_ERROR otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Secure Digital (SD) Driver.

detaileddescription.para: The SD driver is designed to serve as an interface to perform basic transfers directly to the SD card.
This section will cover driver usage.
Refer to the Driver's Configuration section for driver configuration information.
